"Semantic Advertising Solutions"
Peer39, Inc. is an online semantic advertising company based in
New York City , with research and development facilities in
Israel .
Peer39 applies the principles of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning to online advertising solutions for publisher sites, including user-generated content, social networks, blogs and online forums. The company also maintains a lab in its research center that focuses on semantic technology, web classification and the development of new
Web 3.0
capabilities in the fields of advertiser brand protection, page sentiment analysis and content monetization.
Peer39 was founded in early 2006 by engineers and scientists from academic research centers including the
Institute for Advanced Study
at Princeton and the Technion â€“ Israel Institute of Technology. The company is backed by
Canaan Partners and has raised funding from Canaan,1
JPMorgan and Dawntreader Ventures.2 3 4
In July 2008, Peer39 was named one of Ten Web Startups to Watch5 by MIT's
Technology Review . Also in July 2008, the company was chosen by Silicon Valley venture organization AlwaysOn (AO) to the Global 250, recongizing Peer39 as one of the top 250 private technology companies in the world.6
